derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English from Old French cancelier, from late Latin cancellarius 'porter, secretary' (originally a court official stationed at the grating separating public from judges), from cancelli 'crossbars'

entry.def: Chancellor is the title of the head of government in Germany and Austria.
In Britain, the Chancellor is the Chancellor of the Exchequer.
The Chancellor of a British university is the official head of the university. The Chancellor does not take part in running the university.
The head of some American universities is called the Chancellor .

means.word_mean: 1. the person who is head of state (in several countries)
2. the honorary or titular head of a university

sentences.en: The Chancellor of the Exchequer deals with taxes.

jushi.english: In Britain the Chancellor of the Exchequer deals with taxes and government spending.
jushi.chinese: 英国的财政大臣负责税务和政府的开支。

jushi.english: The Chancellor of Exchequer will present his budget to Parliament tomorrow.
jushi.chinese: 财政大臣明天将向议会提出预算案。

jushi.english: The Prime Minister declined to go into details on the contents of his talks with the Chancellor of the Exchequer.
jushi.chinese: 首相拒绝谈论与财政大臣会谈的详细内容。
